title: Tab/panel closing prompt
author: farosch
body_snippet:
## Expected Behavior
 - Do not show prompt on connection tab
 - Do not show prompt when panel only contains one connection

## Current Behavior
![2019-01-13_12-28-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22905106/51084719-ec2fc980-172e-11e9-98ac-fc7600ea5cc7.gif)

## Your Environment
<!--- Include as many relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->
* Version used: Latest RemoveMagicLib branch
* Operating System and version: Windows 10 1809 x64

iterations.description: The user requests a confirmation prompt when closing docked panels (like Connections or Config) to prevent accidental closure, similar to the existing warning for connection tabs.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: Related to this: we should have a way to determine if a DPS panel is a "connection" panel or a "connection group" panel.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The user requests a confirmation prompt when closing docked panels (like Connections or Config) to prevent accidental closure, similar to the existing warning for connection tabs.
Approach: Add a 'Warn when closing panels' setting in Options > Tabs & Panels. Override OnFormClosing in BaseWindow (base class for panels) to check this setting and show a confirmation dialog.
